title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10 §§ 14-5.43 - Fresh fruit washing
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10 §§ 14-5.43 - Fresh fruit washing

State Regulations

Fresh fruits which may be eaten without peeling are to be thoroughly washed in potable water at the packing plant by the processor, or at the commissary before being placed in the vending machine for dispensing. The washed fruit is to be protected from contamination after the washing process. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10
§§
14-5.43

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
